reviews.review: I thought it was written to try to recapture some young fans that have grown since the first Frozen. I went with my 5 year old daughter, who has loved Frozen since she was a toddler. I happened to hit the sweet spot during Frozen madness. Although, some of the storyline went over her head, she totally enjoyed the movie & experience of seeing on opening night with a bunch of other younger children. Id recommend it to any of you Frozen fans out there.
Really liked the theme and special effects
It was awesome my kids also loved it lol

Absolutely loved it -- better than the first!   i'm just... amazed that Disney allowed this movie to exist as it does, that they let it be so dark, and odd, and vaguely disconcerting.  I think it threw a lot of people off, but wow, was it the right thing to do.

I think some people wanted it to go in the opposite direction -- to be more meta and self-aware?  The first movie was so instantly notable because it was "a clever deconstruction" on the classic Disney princess-falls-in-love story.  It was candy, and it veered a little too close to the knowing wink-wink-nudge-nudge of Shrek and Wreck-It Ralph, if you ask me.

This movie is not that.  They ditched the theme park and went off into the endless existential wilderness, and the results are... spectacular.  And slightly unnerving.  And incredibly beautiful. 

Some of the imagery at the end of the movie is the most gorgeous i've ever seen.  And i was unbelievably impressed at the austerity and restraint in the visuals...

... i mean, the previews before the movie were for more typical CGI abominations like Onward, Spies in Disguise, and Scoob!, and those movies just look cluttered, oversaturated, and toylike compared to the autumnal grandeur of Frozen II.

"Lost in the Woods" is hilarious.  My god. 

Olaf is a much better character this time. 

Elsa, the dark ocean, the cave.  Legendary.  Where have we ever seen anything quite like this before?

My only complaint is that it seemed too short, a little abbreviated?  It seemed like some of the secondary characters and parts of the journey could have been beefed up more -- i think this movie could have been even better as a 2:20 monstrosity, instead of the streamlined 1:40 delight that it is.  

^__^

I am going to watch this movie so many times when it comes to Disney Plus.  I'm just gonna have it on in the background all the dang time.
Corny no where near as good as the 1st one. The music could've been much better and my 6 yr old was not even convinced by the movie..

The animation was great. The songs were as good as they could be, considering that the story was just kinda lame, and obviously forced. Even Kristoff's AMAZING song just felt out of place with the tone of the movie. Olaf character wasn't quite there. He seemed to be missing something that made him what he was. This was the first time I have ever left a Pixar film disappointed.
